member_organisations:
ECSLA offers membership to national association which represent cold storage and logistics companies but also to individual companies where no such organisation exists. In addition we also accept associated members - companies that supply their products to our members. 
 
http://www.ecsla.eu/membership/members/
fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Agriculture, Trade, Consumers, Customs, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Single market, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Trans-European Networks, Food Safety, Transport, Climate Action
eu_initiatives: REFIT on the General Food Law, Official Controls Regulation & implementation, food safety and hygiene rules, traceability of foodstuff, food waste; Circular economy package, implementation of the F-Gas Regulation, energy efficiency, heating and cooling strategy, renewable energy, energy performance of buildings; transport & issues in particular logistics
organisation_name: European Cold Storage and Logistics Association (ECSLA)
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
commission_expert_groups_and_other_simil: EU Platform on Food Losses and Food Waste#E03421#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=3421#Member#C#Consultation Forum according to Art. 23 of Regulation (EU) No 517/2014 on fluorinated greenhouse gases#X03338#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=3338#Member#C#Advisory Group on the Food Chain and Animal and Plant Health#E00860#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=860#Member#C
membership:
ECSLA is a member of UEAPME - the European Association for small and medium sized enterprises 
www.ueapme.com
goals__remit:
ECSLA represents the interests of the temperature controlled logistics companies at the level of European and international Institutions in order to contribute to the development of a legislative and economic framework addressing the competitiveness of industry, food quality and safety, consumer protection and respect for the environment.  
In this regard ECSLA aims  
•    To represent the common interests of its Members at EU institutions (in particular the European Commission, the Council and the European Parliament). 
•    To give information on legislative and technical developments regarding the cold storage and temperature controlled logistics industry to the ECSLA Members. 
•    To be a platform for discussions for the European cold storage and temperature controlled logistic sector.  
•    To ensure the promotion and the defence of the cold storage and temperature controlled logistics industry in Europe. 
•    To assist Members in an evolving economical area, in keeping welfare and competitiveness.
